content:
Very cute puzzle. :)

I tried to make a lazy solution in Bash using one of the coreutils that gives an error if there is a loop detected.

https://ato.pxeger.com/run?1=LY1NCsIwFAb37xQfoYiCWbS4EEq9SOkiPy-kEIw06U68iJss9ASextsoNNuZgXm-tEq-lPeanTx_NS_L0OwTW7THzt5ziktGd9m1B5odxhHNv8DwgAgx3gSmqUf2fCUAbHysvAeHxJWYNUjLMikjyM3bqQ7LR9GJFDRpGDKwZMGb-gE

err=$(sed 1,2d|tsort 2>&1)
if [[ $err =~ "loop" ]]; then
   echo "loop"; else echo "cul-de-sac"
fi

But it ignores the part about the start point and just checks whether the nodes have a loop at all, so only works for 60% of tests and validators.

Well designed clash, can't take shortcuts with GNU coreutils like I'd hoped. :P :)
